name: Muslim American Youth Foundation
mission: Our mission is to educate and instil a drive for personal academic success, enrich through experience and expansion of what is really possible, and enlighten by means of taking the aforementioned experiences and incorporating them into their personal lives, households and communities.
theoryOfChange: Educate, Enrich, and Enlighten: providing culturally relevant and spiritually grounded programs (inputs) to strengthen identity and values (outputs) to enable youth to lead and uplift communities (outcomes).
zakatClaimEvidence: The official website and descriptions of Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) programs do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or zakat campaigns. The organization focuses on empowering and uplifting Muslim-American youth and their communities through educational, sports, faith, health advocacy, and social justice programs.

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work

components.evidence: Niche cause: RELIGIOUS_CULTURAL (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 30/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Muslim American Youth Foundation earns 54/100 due to good alignment and moderate impact (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The official website and descriptions of Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) programs do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or zakat campaigns. The organization focuses on empowering and uplifting Muslim-American youth and their communities through educational, sports, faith, health advocacy, and social justice programs.

all_citations.claim: The organization is a registered non-profit focused on youth education and community services.
The charity reported total revenue of $1,734,105 and a program expense ratio of 72.1%.
Programs include youth sports, athletics, mentoring, and community services.
The organization accepts charitable donations and Sadaqah to support its operations.
The foundation offers engagement opportunities for community members to support youth development.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization shows solid financial health and fundraising efficiency, though its overall score is moderated by a lack of independent impact verification and lower data confidence.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party impact data and external evaluations
Lower data confidence due to limited public reporting on specific program outcomes

dimension_explanations.alignment: As a Sadaqah-eligible organization, MAYF aligns with donors interested in religious and cultural youth development [4]. The alignment score is balanced, reflecting a medium donor fit for those seeking to support community-based athletics and mentoring programs [3][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation allocates a 72.1% program expense ratio toward its core mission of youth education and community services [2]. While the organization demonstrates financial stability with 13.4 months of working capital, the impact score reflects a focus on capacity building rather than direct, independently verified beneficiary outcomes [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim American Youth Foundation provides a dedicated space for youth education, enrichment, and athletic development.
strengths: Efficient fundraising operations with a cost of only $0.03 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity position with 13.4 months of working capital available
Diverse programming including youth sports, mentoring, and community services
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) operates as a non-profit organization dedicated to creating facilities for youth enlightenment and community services [1][3]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $1,734,105 to support its mission of mentoring and athletics [2].

areas_for_improvement.context: The current <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 72.1%</cite> is below the <cite id="12">peer median of 80.0%</cite> for religious and cultural organizations.

case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="5">lower-than-average program spending</cite> and a lack of verified outcome data.

confidence.notes: Low data confidence due to limited transparency and lack of external audits.

alignment.explanation: The organization is a strong fit for those prioritizing <cite id="4">religious and cultural youth development</cite> within the American Muslim community.
alignment.improvement: Highlighting the <cite id="7">humanitarian dimensions</cite> of its community services could further enhance its alignment with donor priorities.

credibility.explanation: Donors can verify the organization's growth through <cite id="2">official Form 990 filings</cite>, though overall data confidence is limited by a <cite id="13">lack of external transparency seals</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should <cite id="13">publish annual impact reports</cite> and seek third-party transparency certifications.

impact.explanation: The foundation operates a <cite id="1">capacity-building model</cite> with a clear theory of change, though the <cite id="5">72.1% program ratio</cite> suggests room for more direct service allocation.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value long-term institutional stability and want to invest in the infrastructure of Muslim American youth athletics and mentoring.

Value organizations with strong financial reserves

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects a clear strategic mission but a lack of published outcome metrics or independent evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization focuses on providing physical facilities and mentoring to foster youth enlightenment and community health.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that youth mentoring programs are effectively translating into positive social outcomes.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The organization's rapid growth and $1.7M revenue suggest a high capacity to absorb new funding for facility expansion.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by <cite id="8">exceptionally high working capital (13.4 months)</cite> compared to peers.

similar_organizations.name: Tayba Foundation

strengths.detail: The organization demonstrates high fiscal discipline, requiring only <cite id="6">$0.03 in expenses for every $1 raised</cite>.
MAYF maintains <cite id="8">13.4 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, ensuring continuity of youth services.
The foundation achieved a <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of 73.3%</cite>, growing from roughly $577k to over $1.7M.

strengths_deep_dive: The Muslim American Youth Foundation has successfully transitioned from a local initiative to a significant institutional player, as evidenced by its <cite id="2">$1.7 million revenue</cite> and <cite id="9">$5.3 million in total assets</cite>. Its governance structure is robust, featuring an <cite id="10">independent board of 5 members</cite> and a clear <cite id="1">documented theory of change</cite> focused on capacity building. Furthermore, the organization has successfully secured external validation through institutional support, including a <cite id="11">$62,500 grant from the Hilal Foundation</cite> and support from Enterprise Community Partners.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) serves as a vital hub for youth development, operating with a mission to <cite id="1">create and operate a facility for youth education, enrichment, and enlightenment</cite>. Based in the United States, the organization has demonstrated significant financial growth, reporting <cite id="2">total revenue of $1,734,105</cite> in the 2023 fiscal year. This represents a robust <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of 73.3%</cite>, indicating a rapidly expanding donor base and operational scale. MAYF’s programming is multifaceted, encompassing <cite id="4">youth sports, athletics, mentoring, and faith-based programs</cite> designed to foster community leadership. While the organization maintains a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 72.1%</cite>, it excels in fiscal efficiency regarding donor acquisition, spending only <cite id="6">$0.03 to raise every $1</cite>. The foundation also provides <cite id="7">health advocacy and access to services</cite>, positioning itself as a comprehensive resource for the Muslim American community. Its financial stability is further underscored by a <cite id="8">working capital ratio of 13.4 months</cite>, providing a significant buffer for long-term project sustainability.
